@VodafoneUK Connectivity issues. Not ringing despite volume on, missing calls, won’t connect to wifi or Bluetooth. I’ve done every trouble shoot I was told with no luck. The phone is 2 months old & these issues for weeks now.
@VodafoneUK I haven’t sent it off yet as had to be on the phone over 3 days for an hour at a time to even get to this point. It still leaves me without a phone 😡

@VodafoneUK I’m appalled yet again at your customer service & ask myself why I’m a customer? A brand new phone, not working yet u won’t replace it & I have to be left without a working phone for 7 days while I repair it! Disgraceful! I’m self employed & my office is my phone 😡

@Valvaliantthor7 @VodafoneUK They’re absolutely terrible. Think I’m moving to EE when my contract runs out. Right now they’re trying to charge my mum £1000 a month (it should only be about £300) and they’ve cut my SIM off because she’s obviously not paying £1000… abysmal.
@VodafoneUK is this a joke? https://t.co/8Nk4IcPihC

@VodafoneUK Most of the operator submissions to Ofcom’s recent net neutrality review flag up slicing as an area of concern. There has been discussion about whether network slicing can be classified as a specialized service, but less on how that would work in practice. https://t.co/gJP5UWTq8o
@hannahdillonxo @VodafoneUK They’re trying to charge my mum £1000 a month, scammers

@VodafoneUK Nice teaser for this announcement too, completing on-demand automated 5G network slicing with Ericsson. Working towards end 2022 for customer proof-of-concepts. Concerns that net UK neutrality regulation cannot accommodate slicing or is at best ambiguous. https://t.co/TuZGUJN0T7

Thanks to Andrea Dona and Ahmed El Sayed @VodafoneUK for a great briefing on UK network and IT evolution yesterday. Interesting to hear how a group culture is really starting to take hold and how the One Tech Team approach is offering agility and growth.
